resumo: "Hans Holbein the Younger, Volume 1" by Arthur B. Chamberlain is a historical account written in the early 20th century. The book provides a comprehensive exploration of the life and works of the renowned painter, delving into the various artworks, historical contexts, and his family background. It serves as a significant resource for art historians and enthusiasts alike, illuminating the impactful contributions of Holbein and his lineage.  The opening of the volume lays the groundwork by discussing the life of Hans Holbein the Elder, the father of Hans Holbein the Younger. It explores his artistic development and contributions to the Swabian School of painting, providing a backdrop for understanding the eventual prominence of his son, Hans Holbein the Younger, in the world of Renaissance art.
